The only thing worse than the homework are the TESTS, which are ridiculously difficult. They have almost nothing to do with anything you learn in class. But, he's gives a great curve.

Teaches his class in a way that when he asks you if you have any questions, you're so lost you don't even know what questions to ask. Tests are designed for science graduate students rather than the poor non-science majors forced to take the course. Show up for every class, don't bother buying the book and ask questions if you can come up with any.

I took H161 and H162 back to back, and they are by far, THE most difficult classes you will ever take in your whole life. You will understand NOTHING...but prof Gould rocks my socks! He is hilarious, and nerdy, and I just adore him. Go to office hours!! I averaged about a 50 on all exams and got an A- and an A respectively. Don't buy the book.

This class is useless. There are two midterms and a final, plus eight homework assignments, most of which are impossible to complete. Don't even bother buying the book, and why study when you aren't going to get better than a 50% anyway? Doesn't even bother to show up on exam day, and lectures are useless. Show up for the exams.

Andrew Gould is a conundrum wrapped in an enigma. He teaches his class as if it were full of science graduate students, when in fact it is full of humanities and business Honors kids who just want to fulfill a GEC. Funny guy, in a 'wears-shorts-when-it-snows' way. Very tangential. Don't expect to understand 40% of his lectures. Curves heavily.

Tests are impossible. The average is usually a 40%. Homework is easier, but still hard. He'll give you some BS at the beginning of the class about "teaching you to think in a new way."  Don't believe it.  The upsides are you don't have to show up (since you'll do awful on the tests anyways) and he curves generously at the end of the quarter.

Best prof I've ever had.  Extremely smart and funny.  Test was worth 200 pts, but he took it out of 100 cause we all would have failed.  It's tough, but if you come every day and participate he will like you and give you a good grade.

He has an abstract way of teaching. He wears shorts as long as its 25 degrees and up. His test are literally designed for you to fail, but its purpose is to challenge you. Take him if you're willing to not know your grade until its posted at the end of the quarter (no real grading scale).

This class was a challenge.  Go to class, you cannot get by just reading the book (I wouldn't buy it).  The homework is ridiculous sometimes, but the professor really cares about his students learning to approach things scientifically.  Curve at the end of the course is easy, but you feel like an idiot after every test.

I took his class a while ago, and it was an EARLY class. I hate those mandatory GEC courses, but I loved this prof. I thought he was a terrific teacher - very helpful, inspiring, creative - and recently he discovered a new star, so hats off to Andy all around!
difficult, but worth it.
Brilliant man.  Will intellectually challenge you.  Slackers need not apply.

interesting person
very interesting person, enjoyable class

WARNING!!! This professor is awesome!  If you don't like one sentence questions on exams that are extremely straight forward DO NOT TAKE HIM! Dr. Wenzel is funny, knowledgeable, and a quality professor. I took the class thinking, "eww bugs" but he presents the material in an amusing and very intriguing way. Highly recommended!!

Like everyone said, amazing professor! VERY FUNNY and makes class interesting. Also, the book is not required (wouldn't even buy it) which is good. Dr. Wenzel is an excelent lecturer!  He makes biology interesting and I think he's really funny.  The labs were kind of dumb, but that's not his fault.  He understands that we are not science majors, so he tries to make biology relevant to our lives and interesting.

Dr. Wenzel is a very intelligent, fun guy. He is extremely interested in helping students who want to help themselves. He adds humor to his class and he is an all around awesome dude!! I hope to take another class of his someday! You won't regret taking his class...that's a promise!! He's the first to make Biology fun for me!! Take his classes!!
Makes lecture really intersting
dude was great

No reason to buy the book with this good of lecturer. The tests come from lecture anyway. Lectures are pretty good considering that I don't really care about biology and he keeps me interested/awake. I would defiantly recommend him.

I'm going to take his Entomology 333 class. Best prof. I had so far.

Wenzel is hilarious! His lectures are very interesting. Attendance isn't mandatory but midterms and finals are 90% from the lectures. The book is hardly ever used, I wouldn't buy it. Amazing teacher. Lecture was very fun and interesting. He makes things funny and relates to college students. I laughed everyday in lecture.

Makes Bio very interesting and fun. very witty guy. lecture attendance isn't mandatory but I HIGHLY recommend it. exams rely heavily on lectures, not really on books (I wouldn't get it unless you need a lot of visual help understanding things). Definately take Wenzel if he is teaching Bio.
Quality professor

I would suggest taking this course from him because he deals with the large crowd very well.  He's very intelligent...a little biased about bugs but thats beside the point;)  I enjoyed him.

Most interesting class I've ever had! He's beyond great, one of the few professors that actually care about students. He listens to your needs and is very flexible about things. Going to class is actually very enjoyable. Quizzes are easy, midterm and finals are a bit harder, but if you study, it'd be real hard not to do well.

so much fun, wants you to learn, very good professor.

well organized and mostly interesting lectures.  took questions before exams, which was very helpful (although he always seemed stressed/pissed on exam days, which i found curious).  wears what i think were cowboy boots sometimes which is lame but other than that a great prof.

Very good, animated, energetic, and interesting. I've taken several of his courses because I enjoy his lecures.

great guy

Class can be very boring at times. But McKenzie is very passionate about the subject matter. My only real complaint other than being bored at times is that he is quite disorganized. But I would say all in all he isn't bad.

Garry is an extremely nice guy.  He gave us cookies during our final.  The subject matter and the lecs were very interesting.  Yes, he was a little dissorganized, but that didn't really matter since he made it clear what topics were important to focus on for tests and such.  Thumbs up for this cool Canadian!

Not a real hard class.  His final was directly from previous midterm questions.  Got B+ but not sure how. Thought that I should have done better but would not email me back after I emailed him twice. frustrating

Classes were kind of boring but they were tolerable. Most of the material somewhat interesting. Pretty straight foward with what he wants. Go to most classes, read the chapters, and go to labs and you will do good in the class. Seems like a pretty cool guy.

i liked him, i became interested as class went on.

awesome prof. go to class, take notes, do review questions and memorize those questions. questions are what make up the test. guaranteed A-. let's you argue unfair grading. doesnt make it difficult. seminars are annoying for scheduling, but easy way to cushion your grade. i had a 96. interesting too. take this class!

SUCH a good teacher.  I hate bio, and he really made lectures interesting!  His exams are kind of difficult, but it really isn't that hard to get an A in the class.  Would recommend him to anyone!!!

not too difficult of a class, but the tests are full of trick questions so be sure to know the material.  DO NOT need the book, nor do you need a paid subscription to the Times (articles online).  at one point preached his political views which i was not happy with, but other than that not a bad guy

Test were ridiculous because of the purposefully tricky wording, but the class itself is not difficult. Go to lecture (and lab of course) and you'll get a decent grade. I cannot stress enough - DO NOT BUY THE BOOK. You might as well flush your cash down the toliet.

Easy labs, clear lectures, no required attendance.  The problem is that his test are extremely difficult.  He has tons of questions that are worded for the purpose of tricking people and as a result one of the exam averages was 62%.  He also tends to get a bit preachy at times and only likes to discuss his way of thinking.

His tests are really hard and he complains a lot about stuents not being at lecture but doesn't do anything about it. He is good at explaining things but it is difficult to judge what he might use on a test, so as a result the tests have pretty low averages. He makes up for it by having easy labs (even if they are elementary.

Interesting and funny teacher. Bio 101 may suck but if you have to take it this guy is not bad. His lectures are actually pretty interesting at times. Exams are difficult; make sure you read the NYT articles. Lab grades will help you out a lot. Do NOT buy the book!

I loved going to lectures because he makes them really interesting. He makes jokes and does animal impressions which is always worth seeing.  Definately take him and do not buy the book. Go to the lectures and you won't have to spend much time studying for exams.
teaches definitions, tests on application...very difficult quizzes, hope for a good TA to keep your points up

He has a weird sense of humor and tries to keep the lecture interesting. A lot of the tests are conceptually based but if you attend lecture you should be able to handle it. He gives take home essays for each exam which really helps to boost your grade if you need it.

If you have to take Bio 101...take it with Ralph Boerner!! He is very easy. I literally never studied for a quiz until I got to his class during lectures...and his quizzes covered the materials only covered in class and the New York Times Articles. You don't need a book for the class because you will NEVER use it.

Very fun and entertaining lectures.  Multiple choice exam portion is theoretical and confusing.  Come to lecture.  Majority if not all of the material is from lecture.  Very funny guy.  Take this class if you have to do fulfill your biology requirement.  He'll assure you do well in his course.

He seems to care a lot about teaching; class interesting and challenging, learned a lot.  He knows his material, for sure. A bit partial to some students he obviously likes, which is offputting to the rest of us.  High quality teacher.

Ok some of his jokes aren't nearly as funny as he thinks they are, but his constant sarcasm and goofiness make the lectures way more interesting. Also, this is hands down the easiest class I've had since probably middle school. I only went the once a week there was a quiz, and to study I just printed the notes off and studied in class right before
He's a bit of a jerk and thinks he's really funny. Got mad that people didn't show up so he started making the class harder.
Everyone in my class thought that the exams were harder than they should have been for a 101 course.  Lectures sometimes were very boring and he tends to take up all of the class period.

This man is amazing.  Somehow he makes an 600 person lecture hall feel like an intimate small biology seminar.  He is enthusiastic, relevant, and exciting.  This was the only class I took this quarter where attendance was not compulsory, and yet I attended every class.  Ohio State should be proud of Ralph Boerner.

Yes, his jokes are corny and he's a little off the wall, but he makes biology extremely interesting. He finds a way to tie in introductory biology material into real world events that affect the way we live. Also, the class is extremely easy and he offers plenty of bonus. The whole not-taking-a-midterm-or-exam thing is pretty nice too.

He is very annoying and thinks he is funny, but really isnt at all.  Everyone in my class thought that the quizzes were harder than they should have been for bio 101.  He was interesting at some points, but was more annoying and should retire.

I loved this class! You really have to come to lectures and study to do well, but it's interesting and Dr. Boerner is a great teacher. The only annoying thing is having to attend seminars and turn in summaries, but it's still not too bad. Highly recommend this class and this prof!
VERY easy class, a joke in fact. But attend lectures and skim the readings and there is NO reason not to get an A. Labs are long, but if you explain your logic, they never took off.
Easy class.  He's a lil out there, but I'd take another class with him in a second.

It's a fairly simple class.  He's a good teacher.  You have to go to all of the lectures if you want to get an A.  Even tho he has the notes online, it doesn't help to skip lectures and read them.  Take my advice, I did this and got a C+ in the class.
A fun class.  If you read the book and go to class, the quizzes aren't bad at all.
Very easy class and he's interesting to listen to. He really knows what he's talking about, but he explains things well. Take his class. He's much better than the other bio teachers.

great professor; it's nice to have no midterms, but quizes are difficult.  He makes lecture interesting because he jokes about almost everything without making the class a joke.  Class is very easy and very interesting.  Great Prof!  TAKE HIS CLASS!
Easiest class ever, boring but somewhat entertaining for an A.
fun to listen to, if you read the book and go to lecture the quizes are very fair
He makes lecutres fun. I  loved the idea of no major studying for a midterm or final!! But still makes you use your brain on quizes, so no getting off the hook really ;-)
made the class entertaining and enjoyable
quizes are all lecture based.  Very fair with material on the quizes.
No Comments
Only quiz's. no exams but it isnt a walk in the park and no curve at the end!
Nice guy...seemed like no exams would be nice but the quizes aren't that easy
Laid back lecturer.  Very knowledgable.  Interesting to listen to.  Learned much
No Comments
His quizzes are super hard, meaning his relaxed lectures aren't what they seem..
Yes he's easy-going but you never know what's important & what's just rambling!
Really easy going. It's not bad going to the big lectures.

I was one of Dr Tettenhorst's very first graduate students, and he was a wonderful advisor and mentor. I received my MS degree from the OSU Mineralogy department in 1968. His teachings and his manner of teaching benefitted me throughout my lifetime in engineering and teaching.

I had him over 20 years ago and went to see if he was on here..and he is...he was lousy in the 80's and the students either got A's or D's, because he was lazy and used the same tests over and over. A fewfemale students go copies of old tests from other guys in his prior classes of his and - automatically got A's somehow. Nobody understood him tho

Someone else already mentioned that he acted like he was the guardian of the gates of geology. That was my same experience. He had his favorites although I'm not sure what made them his favorites. I personally found him to be arrogant, judgmental and cliquish. I got the impression that he thought I was an idiot.

An old fashioned professor; too few like him are left.  If you are lazy, you are in really deep trouble.  If you love geology, this class is utterly foundational and it would hard to find a better professor of mineralogy.  If you hate geology, he'll help you discover that fast.

He felt it was his responsibility to decide who would be geologists, and if he didn't like you...  you were in deep trouble.  His exams bordered on comical.  Mineralogy through intimidation and thinly veiled threats.
His methods and subject matter is outdated and unclear, he is belligerent.
Dr. T is a cool dude.  Strict and serious, but fair and friendly.
Terible class, poorly explained, read from the text book
Dr. Tettenhorst is clearly nuts about geology-cares about teaching it.
Interesting lectures, but frequently strayed from topic.  Did not really seemto care ifwe learned course material or not.  More entertaining than instructive.

She is simply one of the best professors here at Ohio State. She is fun to talk to and her class will be one of the most interesting in your time at Ohio State. Take this class if you need a Bio GEC requirement. She is more than willing to help you at anytime.

Simply the most fun professor ever. She's extremely easy on the grades and due dates, doesn't care much about when you turn in the work, open-book exams. I learned a lot from her, because she gives latest info on everything. Best prof ever.
So Wonderful. No other words to describe. Her T.A. Aiqing is equally as awesome.

This prof is the best! After years at OSU she's the only one who ever bothered to learn my name. You have to take very good notes, otherwise you'll get to a question on the exam and not have a clue how to answer it. Learn how to take short hand notes that you can understand, use keywords, and write down examples she gives you during discussion.  Sh

Class about human diversity.  Really the class teaches you how to think critically about current events.  Can use your notes for the exam, but you have to take great notes and not miss class.  HIGHly recommend!
Very nice.  Class was interesting, and easy  She tends to wander off topic a lot, but she's very well informed and fun.
Interesting class, great teacher! She is very helpful and makes it pretty fun and easy. Take entomolgy with her.

i waited for almost 3 years to take dana's class, and it was totally worth the wait. she doesn't always stay on task but she is SO interesting and helpful it doesn't matter. i'm in ento 102 now and was plenty prepared for it. take ANYTHING she teaches she is really helpful and as long as you put in some effort she'll give you an A.

Hard to understand (talks very fast), rambles all over the place, doesn't teach the course description but rather rambles about all sorts of biology/current events. Pretty fun and relaxed atmosphere, however I don't really feel like I learned too much, as a result.

Dana is an amazing instructor and will make you reconsider almost everything you thought you knew about biology!  She really gets you to think about biology and bugs rather than just assimilate information.  Her teaching style is such that you don't need t
helpful, awesome teacher. TAKE HER CLASS

A friend of mine had Dana for 597, and I was so intrigued by his stories, I emailed Dana, and we have kept up a friendship, even though I've never had her as a teacher.  She is AWESOME and I have learned so much from her, just about life in general.  If you have the chance, take ANYTHING with her.
Really enjoyed her class.  She knows so much and she is the best teacher I have had here at OSU..
She lets you turn in work as late as you want.  She is always willing to help.  Note taking is hard but if you do everything and be nice to her you'll probably get an A.

This is an awesome teacher! I highly reccomend this class and teacher to anyone who loves science, or loves the study of bugs or who needs a science credit but finds science to be hard. Dana Wrensch makes science very fun and interesting. I would take any class with her in a heartbeat!!!
Dana is my favorite teacher at OSU, her class is easy but interesting, and there is a big curve even though most people don't need it.

Great personality hilarious lady.  She is very smart but EASILY sidetracted in class.  You will get a lot of info but note taking can be difficult.  She will help you with tests in class.  She has a lot of info to share, cool professor. highly reccomend.

She is by far the best teacher at OSU, her tests are essay style so if your not an idiot you can BS through.  I took both classes she teaches and got a's in both.  Great personality and the fact she gets so off subject makes her hilarious.
Do not take this class. She rambles in lectures about things irrelevant to class. Her tests have nothing to do with anything that was covered. Notes are impossible to take in her class.

She is my favorite professor at Ohio State.  By far, the coolest lady you'll meet.  Very personable--almost impossible to fail her class.  Do yourself a favor and take her class.  I PROMISE you'll love her.

Good teacher.  Helps out a LOT. Like, she will help you with projects in EVERY aspect of it if you just ask her.  Rambles a little bit.  Tests are in the middle of an easy/hard continium.  Little hw.  Big projects at the end of quarter.  must go to lectur

Dr. Doseff scared me a lot because of her bluntness with students in class, but really is a lovely person who cares a lot. Class isn't mandatory but there are activities often for credit. Her lectures are fantastic- I never found myself dazing off- she gives great personal examples & clearly loves her work. Very high expectations. Tough exams.

She can be intense but I thought she was super kind and sweet. Loved her. Class participation during lectures, I thought it was engaging + helpful. Lecture is from slides but she does a lot of talking that's not on the slides. I had already taken AP Bio before so I just studied the slides and easy A. She really cares about students' understanding.

Dr. Doseff is very intelligent and engaged in her subject matter. I found her lectures somewhat difficult due to the fact that English isn't her first language, but she's more than willing to give clarification in office hours. Her lectures work very well along with the textbook.
Easy tests.  Only counted 2 of 3 midterms but bad teacher.  I had to learn everything from the book.

Dr. Doseff is a very engaging and knowledgeable lecturer. She really knows what she's talking about. Go to lecture and take additional notes. She sometimes walks through problems you need to know. Do the extra exercises she posts.

Her exams are pretty easy as long as you have done the problems that she assigns. In fact, on some of the midterms they were the exact same. She is clear in the lectures and emphasizes key concepts she wants you to grasp. Bring the posted lectures notes to class to take additional notes.
knowledgeable but impatient with students. seems to have no compassion for students actually trying to work hard and succeed. lectures are incredibly boring and long-winded

She wasn't bad. As long as you did the reading and looked over her slides and the practice exams you are gonna do well.  I never actually spoke to her though. She plans on teaching more than she can actually fit into the course it seems.

I don't know where to start.  Once again, another upper level professor who just doesn't teach anything of relevance to the exams.  If she is paired in the MOL GEN sequence, wait a quarter for the other prof.
Went through things very quickly in class, very picky grading on the tests, it is very necessary to go to a TA to figure out the practice problems and do well on the tests

She really sucks, i got a 3.8 gpa in my third year as a science major, and she isn't the worst teacher, but she is terrible at explaining anything.  If it makes it any better tho, her exams arent THAT hard if you just study sample problems.
She's atrocious, for God's sake. She ruins a class that should be really interesting. Buy the book because you won't learn anything from her.
she is not very good
She's not so bad. Boring, but not so bad.

HORRIBLE professor. He doesn't teach anything in lectures, but somehow happens to talk the entire time. His exams do not at all reflect what his slides say. A lot of the statistics used on the exams are outdated, so if you google an answer or try to learn on your own, your new stats are considered wrong on the test. He ruined my 4.0 GPA as a senior

You have to do research with Ralph in order to understand how smart this man is.  His knowledge and understanding of the Universe is admirable.  I have the deepest respect for him.  He is a very cool guy.  You have to be good in math and physics to understand his graduate level course material.  :)

He is an expert in his field, and clearly has been for some time.  However, he is not a very effective lecturer; minutes felt like hours in this boring class.  And worst of all, the boring, repeitive tropes of his in-class lectures (and even reviews) had little to do with what was on the test.

He's the typification of someone who's an expert in his field, but not really a teacher. Your performance is determined by how much work you're willing to put into understanding the material on your own. If you're like me, taking your last GEC with a litany of other commitments, his class probably isn't your best choice.

He is a very wise man who may not be the most explicit teacher, but you can definitely learn a lot from him. He discovered the Wilkes Land crater which caused the Permian Triassic Extinction, and he talks about it in class, but he is so humble that he doesn't even mention who discovered it or how it was discovered!

Amazingly Smart Man! He has a very monotone voice and can be tough to follow sometimes but he is really fair. Our first test this quarter was out of 50, he then dropped 2 questions because nobody got them right and then curved it so an A was 33/48. Labs are unstructured but easy. If you go to class there is no reason not to get atleast a B+
this guy is horrible. pointless to study for any tests since no material youre given is contained within the exams
Stupid guy, easy class.
good stuff
No Comments
The questions on tests don't change each year, only the answers Very unclear

How to succeed in his class: memorize everything he writes on the board and study the old exams. Keep up with the material, especially metabolism, because memorizing everything detail can be hard. Also be prepared to hear a lot about Sir Hans Krebs.

Go to class everyday, copy down and memorize EVERYTHING from the class notes, study the old exams he provides on carmen and you'll be fine. Sometimes he does kinda act like it's a chore for him to answer questions. But, overall, good.

This class taught me how to study. Before each midterm, I made flashcards of EVERYTHING he wrote on the board and memorized them over the week leading up to the test. Gives you old midterms which are often identical. A ton of memorization, but I ended up with an A. Class averages were around 80 (84 for the final) so no real curve. Recommended.

An easy class that is 100% memorization. I Spent about 5 hours over the course of the entire quarter studying and still got an A. Marzluf is a nice guy and knows what he's talking about, and the class is easy for anybody who copies down everything he writes and looks at old exams.
Easy A. Just memorize and study an entire week for the exam and you can do it. I didn't learn anything in this class but still did well.

Go to every lecture, take detailed notes, and basically memorize past tests that he gives you. The class is not particularly engaging or challenging, as it is simply mindless cramming. I took 23 credit hours this quarter and with about 30 minutes to 90 minutes a day regularly and more for midterm weeks, I had no problem acing the class.

Biochem is going to be difficult regardless. I am not good at memorization, so this class was very hard for me because it's memorizing soooo many structures/enzymes/cycles for the exams. The only godsend is that the midterms/final isn't cumulative. Also, study the old exams religiously, the questions are often identical.

Prof knew material very well and applied everyday medical conditions to material. Kind of boring class, and have to attend b/c everything is put up on board. Study past exams put up online extensively and should do okay.

I took Biochem over the summer with Behrman before dropping because he was a monster. I've got to say with my experience, Marzluf is probably as good as it gets for Biochem. His exams are difficult, but only because you have to memorize every part of his notes. However, he is extremely fair and will not put anything on that he hasn't covered

He's pretty clear for the most part, you have to go to class since he doesn't use the textbook. Not really tricky on exams,just know all structures and cycles backwards (literally) and forwards, I aced all 3 so not that hard, I'd also recommend his classroom style office hours. I found they really helped. Overall, i'd say take him for biochem

Old prof who makes it a passable class but hard to do well. Pay attention take meticulous notes and study every little thing. Other than that good luck because his exams are rough. I had a 90% on quizzes and 68% on tests they are poorly written

Dr. Marzluf's chalkboard notes are very straightforward and require little to no textbook supplementation.  Quizes and exams are directly out of notes.  This class requires no prior understanding of chemistry - only good memorization skills.  Just stay on top of the material - otherwise it can accumulate quickly.  Dr. Marzluf is a great, funny guy.

He does all of his work on the chalkboard, in small, illegible writing. Gets an attitude when asked to write bigger. Doesn't explain how the ideas connect so it all seems random. Doesn't answer the question asked&sometimes treats you like an idiot for asking. I get good grades in the class but it doesn't take away from him being a terrible teacher.

He is undoubtedly the best of the Biochem teachers (Took and dropped one and had a close friend in the other).  Marzulf will cover the things that are important.  He also makes his previous midterms available at the BioSci Library (Take advantage of this!!!)  Go to class, don't sleep/skip, and you will do fine.  High emphasis on class material.

I bet the last poster didn't come to class very often or did not take advantage of his office hrs.  Well, that is his/her fault for not keeping up and not taking the effort to understand biochem.  If the class avg on a biochem exam is over a 80% then how is it hard? Dr. Marzluf is simply amazing.  He will make sure that you understand the material.

Not a big fan of this guy. His notes are confusing, he doesn't label anything, and usually he makes no sense.  He does not do thing sequentially and his train of thought is a bit hard to follow, even if you do read before class. He's a really nice guy, but as far as his teaching goes, I'm not impressed.

great professor. i thought i would hate this class but i now think it is pretty interesting. class is pretty hard though and requires quite a bit of studying, but the tests are fair. he is also funny whether intentionally or not

He is the best teacher ever! Although there is a lot of material to cover, he never rushes through anything and his tests are VERY clear. This is probably my favorite class! He is a very nice man and he genuinely wants his students to get good grades. Take him for this class!!

this class is seriously rough, but i don't think it is the prof's fault. a LOT of information gets covered, but he thinks it should be a 2 or 3 quarter class, so at least he knows the problems with the class. his notes are generally clear, and there aren't too many surprises on the tests.

He's a terrific prof. The BEST one to have for Biochem because he never rushes over any material. The book is not necessary for a good grade, as long as you go to class every day. If you go to office hours with questions, he's helpful and understanding. I went into the class expecting difficult, boring material and though it was hard, I enjoyed it.
Amazing teacher
its a hard class, but if u understand the lectures and take good notes you will do very well in the exams ! he is very nice and helpful
Very knowledgable, but the lectures are sometimes boring. He teaches away from the book sometimes and the tests are difficult because they are all short answer questions.

He is a really nice guy, and his lectures are pretty clear.  But it's true that he teaches away from the book. He doesn't spend time on the basics.  He is very details oriented.  The tests are tough, all short answer.  You really have to know your stuff.  Listen and take excellent notes.
His graduate classes make it easy for unthinking  crammers. In that sense they defeat the purpose of attending graduate school. However, the course material is carefully selected and relevant.

Is boring, talks very quietly and slowly. Lectures would be interesting if I could stay awake. Tests are hard due to the fact that they are completely lecture-based, which is a problem if you can't stay awake. Good guy, very knowlegable though.

His tests are very hard and focus details. He doesn't use the book much or list any suggested readings that perhaps my go along with the lecture,you spend $$ on a book and is nothing like the lecture. He also has a problem with the microphone.

Had 17 years ago in grad school.  Real good prof.  Challenging, but fair - same for exams.  Up to date on current research.  You could tell he puts a lot into it.  A star for the Buckeyes for sure.  Nice guy too.
His exams are hard, very details oriented, he focuses on application rather than principle but if you acutally listen to him you should be okay.
His exams are difficult; all short answer and focus on details, but his lectures are pretty understandable.
Avoid him and anything he does. Don't trust him. Dont rely on him. Don't take his courses, and DONT ask him to be on your committee. Now you know.

One of the best and brightests professors I have ever met.  Its like poetry how he explains enzyme kinetics.  His overheads are straightforward and you can tell he puts so much time and consideration into them.
Russ is one of the most influencial professors of my graduate experience.  He is a true scholar, beyond the years...
No Comments
No Comments

Doc Ennis is the man. Really interesting class and he does a tremendous job of explaining the material in a simple manner. I don't think there is any question he cannot answer. Getting an A will require going to (almost) every lecture, and taking notes on the slides as he goes through them. Overall an awesome class.
This guy is the king of all that is holy in this world. Really funny teacher and very helpful.

Dr Ennis is a really nice person. You can feel his passion in astronomy and genuine interest in teaching the class. Caltech and NASA guy, so he knows a lot of stuff. The tests are all MCQ. Oh ya, he tells a lot of jokes and stories :)
really,really interesting class and i would even go to his "evening"class before holidays but he usually cancels his class because of the holidays......He is adorable with his weird jokes.
Loved this class. This prof is so nice and genuine. Really glad i took his class and plan to take 1162
Dr. Ennis is a very smart, friendly, and funny teacher. I enjoyed the class and thought he did a good job explaining things. Just remember to take notes quickly, because the guy talks fast.

Professor Ennis genuinely enjoys teaching and he likes students. He does not require attendance but the way to learn and get an A in the class is to attend every lecture, make notes when he says something is important, and study the powerpoints. The textbook is good. He's interesting, knowledgable, helpful and entertaining. And he likes cats!
if you're interested in astronomy at all take it, it's pretty straight-forward. not quite as exciting as i expected but still good class, and he's a really good guy.

Professor Ennis is now my Favorite instructor.  He has has enough real life experience to make the subject interesting and enjoyable.  I was apprehensive about taking Astronomy as a GEC requirement.  But after sitting in his 161, I knew I would take his 162.  Simply the best teacher I've had so far (and I'm a junior)!

Interesting professor-likes to make nerdy (but funny!) jokes. Sometimes it is a little difficult to sit through class if it's two hours long, but the material is very interesting. Professor is very helpful, but you have to study hard. The only assignments: 4 quizzes and a Final. He posts powerpoints, so you don't have to go to class.

I definitely recommend him if you have to take AST 162. I tried taking it with another professor and had to drop it. He makes the class pretty interesting, and he's good at explaining difficult subjects. He clearly enjoys teaching. As long as you go to class and spend time studying the notes you shouldn't need the textbook.
A really nice professor who extremely enjoys what he is talking about.  His jokes and stories keep the subject entertaining throughout the classes.  Definitely would reccommend this class.
Definitely harder than I expected.  If you know the slides you will do well.  Average was about a 75.  Final was a lot easier than the quizzes.  Got an A but definitely had to work for it

Good teacher, really seems to enjoy teaching the subject and has a lot of past research experience to back up his knowledge.  Tests can be pretty hard at times however, you have to really know the slides that are given out to you.

Currently taking him for 162, he is definitely one of the trickiest professors especially for his quizzes which are hard with questions such as which of the following is not a property of a neutron star, etc. He says they are straight-forward but trust me they are not! I would not recommend him!

def a great professor, interested and lvoes the material he teaches, will do anything to help students understands, takes questions and gives in depth answers freely, great class and pictures! def get him!

This guy has the trickiest tests, he says there stright forward... there not. He likes to hear himself talk too, he is a nice guy and interested in helping, but he is out to trick his students...beware.
He's really easy-going and nice, although sometimes a little confusing. I only studied for like 3 hours before each quiz and exam and still got an A. Funny in a goofy way.
Easy, interesting, and fun class.  If you have to take a science GEC, take 161 and 162.  He is an outstanding teacher.  He's hilarious and a real sweet guy.
Possibly the least tricky exams ever.

PROs: Don't need to buy the book. 80% of test material on power points which are online. Exams are multiple choice. No mandatory attendance. CONs: Very boring, but it was a night class after a long day. It was very hard to want to go to class if you felt you didn't need to. Felt like torture having to sit through it. I never stayed to the end.

I would have to agree with the rest of the recent ratings.  His class bored me out of my mind.  He was interested in what he did, but he was not very straight forward on what was going to be on the exams.  It is too much material to look over without a study guide of what you need to know.  I would not recommend him.

fact one: his lectures are okay. fact two: his exams are insanely tricky. they are NOT easy like what others said. plus, his exams cover too much material. it's like almost impossible to study that much material for the exams. his undergraduate assitant grades assignmets hard too. i won't buy others' comments on this website again.

ennis is a great guy and his class sure is interesting, but his tests suck. they are so tricky. i don't know why all these people say his tests are "easy". i'm not goning to trust comments on rmf any more.
If you have to take a science GEC - TAKE 161 with Ennis. Easy on his students if you go to class. Book is little relevance if you pay close attention. Mr. Ennis is a great prof!

Mmmkay. Mr. Ennis is a great prof. His class was fun and we hardly ever used the textbook. Don't bother buying it, mmmkay. There was almost no math and his lectures were very funny and interesting, mmmkay. The only drawback is that he says "mmmkay" a lot, mmmkay.

excellent professor who truly loves what he does.  Exams are easy and straight forward.  No reading and very little homework.  Class can be interesting but is mostly boring.  You probably do not need to go to class (especially for 161) but I always did anyway for the entire 2 hours 18 minutes, which is probably why I thought it was boring.

I can count on 1 hand how many times I went to class & I still got an A-. Lectures are online, READ THEM. Remember little things like how hot it has to be for nuclear fusion to begin. Homework replaces lowest midterm grade, so do perfect on it! Ennis is a very funny guy and the class is simple as long as u study. If only all classes were like this

Absolutely awesome professor.  He was by far the funniest professor I've had.  He loves to poke fun at himself which is hilarious.  As for the course, exams are all off of lecture and he always tells students that he never tries to trick you, and he holds true to it.  Overall, highly recommended!
No Comments

David Ennis is great. Not only does he make Astronomy accessable to all of us who are just taking it for the GEC, he also keeps the two+ hour lecture lively with bad jokes and colorful powerpoints. I highly recommend him. He's a sweetheart.
One of the easiest, if not the easiest, class i've had in college. Funny Guy. Really enjoyed the class.
He's GREAT GREAT GREAT GREAT!!!  Best professor I've ever had.  He really know the material and and is very passionate.  Also very helpful.  Tests are easy if you study the slides and attend class!
This professor is awesome. If your taking Astro, Ennis is the guy. Go to lecture and you'll do fine. His jokes are quite hilarious, not going to lie.
Great professor.  Class is very interesting and the quizzes easy if you pay attention in lecture.
I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR! He is a great teacher, he gets so excited about astronomy. His jokes are bad, but he's so funny you still laugh. His class is not that hard if you just attend lecture.

Very passionate about astronomy and a good instructor. The quizzes and homeworks are very easy and they come directly from his lectures not the book. The final is also mostly from the same quizzes. Recommend this course to fulfill your GEC.

Was an interesting professor. GO TO CLASS, all the tests are off of the lecture material and slides, you don't need to buy the book at all. Homework was simple and easy especially if you use Wikipedia to look things up.

Dr. Ennis is awesome.  I didn't use the text at all.  If you go to class, pay attention, and take notes you'll be fine.  He makes the funniest comments all the time.  I loved his class, and I've never even been interested in Astronomy.  He loves it, and wants you to like it too.  Seriously, his weird little comments made it worth going.

I was worried this would be harder than 161, but it was actually a lot easier and a lot more interesting.  Class is not necessary, but it's very interesting! Great guy, very easy, I wish I still had him for class!

I had Dr. Ennis for both 161 and 162. I was not interested in astronomy at all but he made it interesting. He has to be my favorite professor at OSU by far. His tests are kind of hard but if you take good notes you should get a good grade. Almost all of his test questions come from class.

This class is pretty easy.  I didn't try this out, but Professor Ennis certainly offers help with anything you may need.  Attendance is not mandatory, but material becomes a lot more clear the more you attend class.  His jokes can be lame at times, but they'll still make you laugh and keep your interest for 48 minutes.  I didn't even buy the text.

the easiest GEC i've had. Dr ennis is one of the funniest professors i've ever had, and probably the absolute most enthusiastic astronomer there is. i learned so much in this class and put no effort into it other than going to class a little more than half the time. book is not necessary at all
Best professor I've ever had. He manages to make huge concepts understandable. He is awesome.

He is an amazing teacher that makes you interested in the material. If you make side notes on his slides then you dont have to study a lot for the test. Go to class and you'll get an A. He is a splendid teacher

WONDERFUL professor!  He made us laugh a lot with his corny jokes.  He loves teaching and does great at it.  I would highly recommend his class,  I heard other ASTR 161 professors were dificult.  It is not hard to do well in this class and you do not need to do any reading.

this is the prof. to have if you need astronomy GEC. he is so sweet. he loves what he is teaching. it is sooo boring (personally) but it is very direct and easy. homework is directly from the notes. quiz questions are very straightforward. powerpoint notes online.

Dr. Ennis is a good guy uses all powerpoint the class is easy, 60% of the class is based on 4 quizzies the were all mutiple choice and preety easy, you get to drop the lowest quiz grade and replace it with HW of which there were only 4 and took about 5 mintues each ... the other 40% is the final of which the questions came directly from the quizzes

Knows what he's talking about, loves teaching and explains everything clearly, don't need book if you attend class. If you have any questions just ask and he'll spend a whole class trying to answer, if need be.  I took this sequence because I enjoyed his person, teaching style, and he just made the material that interesting.

Knows what he's talking about, loves teaching and explains everything clearly, don't need book if you attend class.  If you have any questions just ask and he'll spend a whole class trying to answer, if need be.  He's really personable, I literally spent hours after class talking with him about astronomy and whatever other topic that came up.

Class is pretty easy. He doesn't use the book-all you have to do is study the slides for tests. Any questions just ask him he's a nice guy and knows the subject in and out. He says "mmmkay" a LOT, but it becomes funny after the first couple of classes.

Great class! Very interesting teacher, great way to learn about astronomy, no math, no formulas just facts and interesting stories~~!!!Yay Ennis! easy too...

This class was a breeze. I thought 161 was a lot harder and that professor sucked. Ennis is fine. I maybe went to 2 classes where we didnt have either homework due or a quiz. Just study the slides and you will do fine. He was actually sick for the 1st 2 classes, which made things interesting but it was easy.

Good class, easy grade. Some suprises on the exams, but if you go to class and pay attention, it isn't a problem at all. "Mkay" kind of distracting, but after you spend the first lecture counting how many times he says it, you're already used to it. If you take this class, take it with Dr. Ennis.

I was disappointed in this class. He does not follow the book and does not give study guides. You have no idea what will be on the Tests. Talking to people in the morning AST class their teacher was a lot more organized. I was very disappointed.
Very easy A!! I would tell anyone to take the class.  The quizzes are so easy! I took it as a night class from 5:30-7:40 and I always wanted to fall asleep, but it is for sure an A! :-)
This class is pretty easy, m'kay. Kinda boring but the stuff is pretty interesting, m'kay. Really easy and i recommend to all, m'kay. And by the way, he a hefty Mr. Mackey, m'kay.

Do not take this class. Prof. Ennis is nice but extremely boring his test are very hard if you are not a math/science minded person. I think he thought he was teaching an upperlevel course. I would not recommend this class to anyone who is just trying to fill a gec.
The most interesting and funny science teacher at Ohio State. He prepares you well for the test.

Dr.Ennis class was perhaps one of the most mind numbing experiences I have ever had. His stories ranged from sliver noses to his Toyota Prius to his jealous at another astronomer. I learned everything in this class in one week as a freshmen in high school in Earth Science. Easy Grade
very understandable, made astronomy as interesting as it can be. funny guy

Very funny guy and easy quizzes because the questions just come right off the notes.
Hes really funny, but his class is extremely boring!. And his tests are tough.

I feel bad saying this about Sheldon, because he is a nice old man, but to put it simply, he is the main reason why I am no longer a Pre-med student, his poor teaching in this introductory course put me way behind all of the other chemistry classes which subsequently led to me failing further chemistry courses. Not interested in teaching the class. Find a different professor before it's too late. Has some funny moments but if you're looking to learn the materail lecture is a waste of time. (you might as well just read the book because that's what his lecture is.)

The worst.  Cancels classes because he is not prepared.  Disorganized.  This class is a waste.

Stay away from this professor. You are on your own in this class - no office hours, no reviews and certainly vague, "find the answer yourself" e-mails. The material is quite superficial compare to other biochem classes. Exams are quite simple but require a lot of thinking. Stay away if this will be your first biochem class, but highly recommended if you want to take this class to fulfill an elective credit. Overall, he's a good professor.

Awful prof. does nto test on relevant info, just what he finds important. skips many if not most major topics in  book! no notes given online, no guided notes, no helpful hints, might talk for 45 minutes and only fill up 1 black board. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
